title: Plastic Bottle Recycling
summary_short: Collecting and reprocessing plastic bottles into new products, reducing landfill waste and pollution.
intro_short: Plastic bottles are one of the most common pollutants. Recycling them helps reduce waste, save energy, and protect the environment.
impact: Recycling one ton of plastic bottles saves over 3.8 barrels of oil and reduces carbon emissions by 1.5 tons, helping fight climate change.

title: Ocean Plastic Cleanup
summary_short: Using floating booms and solar-powered systems to remove plastic from oceans and recycle it into usable materials.
intro_short: Massive floating systems collect ocean plastic before it breaks down and harms marine ecosystems.
impact: These efforts remove thousands of tons of waste yearly, protecting marine life and restoring natural ocean balance.

title: Recycled Plastics Manufacturing
summary_short: Producing durable goods like benches, decking, and packaging from recycled plastic materials.
intro_short: Factories transform collected plastic waste into new products like furniture and packaging.
impact: This reduces the demand for virgin plastics, lowering carbon emissions and saving raw resources.

title: Community Composting Hub
summary_short: Turning food scraps and yard waste into compost to support community gardens and reduce methane emissions.
intro_short: Local composting hubs help neighborhoods recycle organic waste into nutrient-rich compost.
impact: Community composting cuts landfill methane emissions and creates healthy soil for green spaces.

title: Campus Compost Program
summary_short: Students collect and compost cafeteria waste, turning it into soil for school gardens and green spaces.
intro_short: Schools and universities engage students in composting projects for sustainability education.
impact: Diverting cafeteria waste reduces methane production and enriches campus gardens.

title: Restaurant Food Waste Recovery
summary_short: Partnering with local restaurants to turn leftover food into compost or donations for community programs.
intro_short: Restaurants collaborate to donate unsold meals or compost their organic waste responsibly.
impact: This approach reduces food waste and helps feed vulnerable populations.

title: E-Waste Collection Drive
summary_short: Collecting and recycling electronic devices like phones, laptops, and appliances to recover valuable metals.
intro_short: Collection events encourage people to recycle old electronics safely and responsibly.
impact: Recovering metals from e-waste prevents pollution and reduces the need for new mining.

title: Laptop Refurbishment Program
summary_short: Repairing and upgrading old computers for reuse in schools and nonprofit organizations.
intro_short: Old laptops are repaired, upgraded, and distributed to schools and nonprofits.
impact: Extending electronicsâ€™ life reduces e-waste and increases digital access.

title: Battery Recycling Stations
summary_short: Setting up drop-off stations for used batteries to prevent chemical leakage and recover rare materials.
intro_short: Battery drop-off bins allow communities to safely dispose of toxic waste.
impact: Battery recycling prevents environmental contamination and supports metal recovery.
